value:
{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.20480v1", "title": "Large-data solutions in one-dimensional thermoviscoelasticity involving
  temperature-dependent viscosities", "summary": "An initial-boundary value problem for \[
  \left\{ \begin{array}{ll}
  u_{tt} = \big(\gamma(\Theta) u_{xt}\big)_x + au_{xx} - \big(f(\Theta)\big)_x,
  \qquad & x\in\Omega, \ t>0, \\[1mm]
  \Theta_t = \Theta_{xx} + \gamma(\Theta) u_{xt}^2 - f(\Theta) u_{xt},
  \qquad & x\in\Omega, \ t>0,
  \end{array} \right. \] is considered in an open bounded real interval
$\Omega$.
  Under the assumption that $\gamma\in C^0([0,\infty))$ and $f\in
C^0([0,\infty))$ are such that $f(0)=0$, and $k_\gamma \le \gamma \le K_\gamma$
as well as \[
  |f(\xi)| \le K_f \cdot (\xi+1)^\alpha
  \qquad \mbox{for all } \xi\ge 0 \] with some $k_\gamma>0, K_\gamma>0, K_f>0$
and $\alpha<\frac{3}{2}$, for all suitably regular initial data of arbitrary
size a statement on global existence of a global weak solution is derived.", "main_category": "math.AP", "categories": "math.AP", "published": "2025-04-29T07:22:29Z"}
